title: Giannis: Haliburton's dad 'disrespectful' with antics
content: Bucks forward Giannis Antetokounmpo got into a heated confrontation with the father of Pacers guard Tyrese Haliburton following Game 5, spurred by what Antetokounmpo called a "disrespectful" exchange on the floor.

title: Celts pounce after Banchero sits, oust Magic in 5
content: The Celtics broke Tuesday night's game open after Paolo Banchero went to the bench with his fifth foul and rolled to a 120-89 victory to close out the series in five games.

title: Brunson a bystander as Knicks wilt late in loss
content: As precious seconds ticked away in the fourth quarter Tuesday night, New York star Jalen Brunson was waiting at the scorer's table for a whistle in the Knicks' 106-103 loss to the Detroit Pistons, who stayed alive in this Round 1 series, forcing a Game 6.

title: 'Confident' Castle gives Spurs back-to-back ROYs
content: Stephon Castle garnered 92 of 100 available first-place votes to give the Spurs the franchise's fourth Rookie of the Year award.

title: Canes win series, spoil Markstrom 49-save outing
content: Sebastian Aho hammered a one-timer past Jacob Markstrom at 4:17 of the second OT to help the Carolina Hurricanes defeat the New Jersey Devils 5-4 Tuesday night to clinch their first-round playoff series and become the first team to advance into Round 2.

title: Luka covers cost to restore vandalized Kobe mural
content: Lakers star Luka Doncic made a $5,000 donation Tuesday to cover the cost of a vandalized mural depicting Kobe and Gigi Bryant in downtown L.A.

title: Yanks make history by again opening with 3 HRs
content: The Yankees became the first team in major league history to open a game with three consecutive home runs more than once in a season.

title: Ex-HS phenom Williams heads to Sacramento St.
content: Ex-prep phenom Mikey Williams has committed to Sacramento State, where he'll play under the tutelage of new GM Shaquille O'Neal and coach Mike Bibby.

title: 'They tell you to keep it down -- don't listen': 30 years of Coors Field horror stories
content: For three decades, baseball at the Rockies' park has bruised ERAs and egos. Here's what it's like on MLB's scariest mound.

title: PSG's Dembélé shows Arsenal what they're missing: a clinical forward
content: Paris Saint-Germain take advantage of their Champions League semifinal first leg against Arsenal, but will the Gunners find a way to turn it around in Paris?

title: The rare play that saves Ja, Donovan Mitchell and other NBA stars -- and it traces back to 1957
content: Players seem to be throwing the ball off the glass to themselves more than ever, and not just to generate highlights.

title: Damian Lillard's injury timeline, plus what to learn from other NBA stars' Achilles tears
content: The Bucks guard faces a long recovery, but there is precedent for stars in their 30s making a full comeback.

title: After a disappointing weekend, the power now belongs to Shedeur Sanders
content: From here on out, all that matters for Shedeur Sanders is proving the Browns were right in selecting him.

title: Home theater, bowling alley and more highlight Deion Sanders' former home listing
content: Sanders' former mansion, which includes a number of impressive amenities, sits on 5.95 acres of land in Texas.

title: Bracketology: Debut predictions for the 2025-26 season
content: With a bevy of returning talent, Purdue earns the top overall seed in the first edition of our projected field.

title: Sources: Ancelotti's move to Brazil hits impasse
content: Real Madrid are unhappy with the timing and financial arrangements of Carlo Ancelotti's exit from the club, leaving his reported move to take over as coach of the Brazil national team in jeopardy, sources told ESPN Brasil.

title: Injured PSG hero Dembélé a 'doubt' for 2nd leg
content: Luis Enrique said Paris Saint-Germain can reach the Champions League final with or without match-winning goalscorer Ousmane Dembélé after the forward limped out of Tuesday's 1-0 semifinal first-leg win at Arsenal.

title: Rüdiger banned 6 games, Bellingham red revoked
content: Real Madrid defender Antonio Rüdiger received a six-game ban after his red card in the team's Copa del Rey final defeat to Barcelona.

title: Arteta: Arsenal need 'something special' in Paris
content: Mikel Arteta has urged Arsenal to do "something special" to beat Paris Saint-Germain next week and reach the Champions League final.

title: Yamal jibes Madrid: Talk when you beat me
content: Yamal said his critics can't touch him while he's winning after boasting about Barça's superiority over Madrid in the aftermath of the Copa del Rey final

title: Miami drawing inspiration from Barça 'remontada'
content: Inter Miami coach Javier Mascherano reminisced on Barcelona's historic 6-1 comeback victory over PSG in the 2017 Champions League round of 16, using that night's example to inspire his players.

title: Firmino, Toney goals send Al Ahli to ACL final
content: Al Ahli beat 10-man Al Hilal in a battle of Saudi Pro League sides in Jeddah on Tuesday to earn a spot in Saturday's Asian Champions League final.

title: Man United stand between Athletic and a dream Europa League final at home
content: Four teams have won a UEFA final at home. Athletic want to be No. 5. First they must beat Man United in the Europa League semis.

title: The 11 most important fights of Canelo Alvarez's career
content: Nick Parkinson picks Canelo's most important boxing performances and shares his thoughts on each of them.

title: Five rookies with breakout potential
content: The 2025 WNBA draft class offers a number of Day 1 contributors outside of Paige Bueckers. Here's who to keep an eye on in fantasy drafts.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye move for $54M-rated Rashford
content: Marcus Rashford reportedly has his heart set on a move to Barcelona. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: UFC 318 reactions: What would a BMF title win mean for Dustin Poirier?
content: Dustin Poirier will take on ex-featherweight champion Max Holloway one last time for the BMF title at UFC 318.

title: Bullet on street, blood on window: K'taka techie shoots family dead in US, kills self
content: Harshavardhana Kikkeri, an entrepreneur from Mysuru, allegedly killed his wife, Shwetha, and their son in their Newcastle, Washington home before committing suicide. The couple's younger son was unharmed. Authorities discovered the bodies after responding to a 911 call, with the medical examiner ruling the deaths of Shwetha and her son as homicides and Harshavardhana's as suicide. The motive remains unknown.

title: 'Credible intel': Pakistan minister claims India planning strike in 24-36 hours
content: Pakistan claims to possess credible intelligence indicating an imminent Indian military strike within the next 24 to 36 hours, alleging it's based on fabricated accusations related to the Pahalgam incident. Pakistan vehemently rejects India's self-proclaimed role as judge, jury, and executioner, asserting its own history as a victim of terrorism.

title: Olympic Council of Asia retains cricket for Asian Games 2026
content: Nagoya is gearing up for the 2026 Asian Games, hosting crucial meetings this week. Technical delegates will convene from April 30th to May 2nd, while the OCA Coordination Committee meets May 1st-2nd. Cricket and Mixed Martial Arts have been officially added to the Games, with MMA making its debut.

title: How a ‘mistake’ by Oracle engineers caused software outage in US hospitals
content: Oracle engineers mistakenly deleted critical storage during routine maintenance, causing a five-day software outage at multiple Community Health Systems (CHS) hospitals. The incident forced facilities to revert to paper-based records, impacting 45 of CHS's 72 hospitals.

title: Watch: Donald Trump jokes he'd 'like to be pope'
content: Donald Trump expressed his desire to be the next Pope, stating it would be his "number one choice," despite being currently occupied as the US President and having been married three times. Following Pope Francis's death, the Catholic Church is seeking a new leader. While Trump mentioned a cardinal from New York, reports suggest Cardinal Joseph Tobin of Newark, New Jersey, is a potential candidate.

title: Why is RBI buying gold & how does it help the Indian economy?
content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has been aggressively buying gold for the last few years. Analysis of World Gold Council data shows that the percentage of gold in India’s total foreign exchange reserves has spiked in the last few years.

title: Indian Army responds 'swiftly and proportionately' to Pakistan firing along LOC
content: Pakistani army violated the ceasefire along the Line of Control, initiating unprovoked small-arms fire in the Naushera, Sunderbani, and Akhnoor sectors. Indian troops responded promptly and proportionately. This escalation occurs amidst heightened tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack. PM Modi has granted the armed forces complete operational freedom to respond to Pakistan.

title: 100 days of Trump: Tesla CEO Elon Musk loses $113 billion, the biggest loss in ...
content: Elon Musk, leading the Department of Government Efficiency under President Trump, has experienced a significant $113 billion wealth decline since January, largely due to a 33% drop in Tesla shares post-inauguration. His close ties with the Trump administration have negatively impacted Tesla, facing sales drops and protests. Musk acknowledges the 'pain' and plans to reduce his involvement with DOGE.

title: Trump congratulates Mark Carney on Canada election win amid tariff tussle
content: Despite strained relations, US President Donald Trump congratulated Mark Carney on his victory in the Canadian national elections. The two leaders acknowledged the importance of collaboration between their nations and agreed to meet soon. Carney previously accused Trump of attempting to undermine Canada's sovereignty, a sentiment that fueled voter turnout and contributed to the Liberal Party's win.

title: Trump-backed crypto firm ties up with Pakistan Crypto Council
content: Amidst heightened India-Pakistan tensions, a cryptocurrency firm with significant Trump family ownership, World Liberty Financial, is engaging with Pakistan to enhance blockchain technology.

title: Intel CEO announces layoffs: Read the full letter he sent to employees
content: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan announced a restructuring plan involving layoffs and management changes to regain competitiveness. The company aims to cut $1.5 billion in operating expenses over two years, focusing on engineering talent and streamlining processes. A return-to-office mandate of four days a week will also be implemented to foster collaboration and innovation.

title: Pakistan stock markets, bonds to see worst month since 2023
content: Pakistan's dollar bonds and equities are experiencing their worst monthly performance since 2023 due to escalating India-Pakistan tensions. Investor confidence has been shaken, leading to declines in Pakistani assets, while Indian markets remain relatively stable.

title: 600 North Korean soldiers killed fighting for Russia against Ukraine: Seoul
content: A South Korean lawmaker revealed that around 600 North Korean soldiers fighting alongside Russian forces in Ukraine have died, with thousands injured. This follows North Korea's confirmation of troop deployment to aid Russia, claiming their soldiers helped recapture areas in Kursk. Approximately 2,000 soldiers have been repatriated and isolated, the lawmaker said.

title: 'MS Dhoni doesn't need to be there next year’
content: Adam Gilchrist has ignited a debate by suggesting that MS Dhoni should consider retiring from playing for Chennai Super Kings after a lackluster 2025 IPL season. While acknowledging Dhoni's legendary status and immense contributions, Gilchrist believes CSK needs to prioritize rebuilding for the future. This raises questions about whether it's time for CSK to transition beyond the Dhoni era.

title: Man lynched for shouting ‘Pakistan zindabad’ during cricket match in Karnataka
content: In Mangaluru, a man was lynched near Kudupu following allegations of shouting pro-Pakistan slogans during a cricket match. Police have arrested 15 individuals and booked 19 in connection with the incident. Home Minister G Parameshwara has appealed for peace, confirming the death and ongoing investigation.

title: Virat Kohli's brother slams Sanjay Manjrekar
content: Virat Kohli's brother, Vikas, has criticized Sanjay Manjrekar on social media following Manjrekar's remarks about Virat's performance in the IPL 2025. Manjrekar suggested Kohli is past his prime, a claim Vikas refuted by highlighting Manjrekar's own ODI strike rate.

title: Oscar Piastri applauds 14-year-old cricket sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi
content: Formula 1's Oscar Piastri acknowledged cricket's newest sensation, Vaibhav Suryavanshi, after his record-breaking IPL century. At just 14 years old, Vaibhav stunned the world by smashing 101 runs off 38 balls for the Rajasthan Royals. His fearless innings against a world-class bowling attack has marked him as a phenomenon, capturing attention across sports.

title: Morning news wrap: Pak says India to attack in '24 to 36 hours', & more
content: Amid rising tensions, Pakistan's information minister claimed credible intelligence suggests a potential Indian military strike within 24-36 hours, while India accuses Pakistan of violating ceasefire. In the US, an Indian-origin tech entrepreneur killed his family before committing suicide. Meanwhile, Donald Trump defended his China tariffs, and young Vaibhav Suryavanshi became the youngest T20 centurion.

title: 'INDI's hand with Pakistan': Posters target Rahul Gandhi in Amethi
content: Posters targeting Rahul Gandhi and INDIA bloc leaders have surfaced in Amethi, accusing them of pro-Pakistan sentiments amid tensions following the Pahalgam attack. The posters feature comments from Farooq Abdullah and Vijay Wadettiwar, labeling Gandhi a terrorism sympathizer.

title: Happy Akshaya Tritiya 2025: 60+ wishes, messages, quotes and more
content: Akshaya Tritiya, an auspicious Hindu and Jain festival on April 30, 2025, is celebrated for its promise of unending prosperity. The day encourages investments and new ventures, believed to bring lasting success. Beyond gold purchases, the article suggests sharing heartfelt wishes and embracing the day's positive energy with family and friends through messages and social media posts.

title: Rohit Sharma makes BCCI shortlist for Test & ‘A’ tour of England
content: The Board of Control for Cricket in India is preparing for the England Test series. A pool of players is ready for both the Test team and the India ‘A’ tour. Rohit Sharma is on the shortlist, with selectors deciding on his captaincy. Rajat Patidar and Karun Nair are being considered for the middle order.

title: Kolkata's Jadavpur University erases ‘Azad Kashmir’ graffiti from campus
content: Jadavpur University administration removed the controversial "Azad Kashmir" graffiti from Technology Bhavan following a demand from the Trinamool Chhatra Parishad unit. The removal, prompted by the Pahalgam incident, was initiated after a March decision to erase the graffiti as part of a campus beautification drive.

title: Woman flyer falls ill after AC failure on Pune-Jaipur Air India Express flight
content: An Air India Express flight from Pune to Jaipur faced a setback. A passenger fell ill due to a faulty air conditioning system. The flight had to return to the bay before takeoff. The airline provided medical assistance to the affected passenger. Passengers were offered refunds or rescheduling options. Air India Express regretted the inconvenience caused to its passengers.

title: How William-Kate celebrated 14th anniversary: Relationship tips to borrow from royals
content: Prince William and Princess Kate are celebrating their 14th wedding anniversary with a romantic escape to the Isle of Mull in Scotland. This trip marks Kate's first overnight stay for royal duties since her cancer battle, highlighting her return to public life. The couple is also engaging in official duties, including visits to community projects supported by their Royal Foundation.

title: What is the difference between vitamin B12 and other B vitamins: Which one to take?
content: Vitamin B complex, encompassing eight essential vitamins including B12, offers comprehensive benefits for energy, brain function, and metabolism. While B complex is suitable for overall well-being, B12 specifically targets red blood cell production and nervous system health, crucial for those with deficiencies or dietary restrictions, especially older adults and vegetarians.

title: ‘Managed to wriggle out onto a ledge’: How 14 died in Kolkata hotel fire
content: A fire erupted at Hotel Rituraj in Kolkata's Mechhua wholesale fruit market, resulting in one death and multiple injuries. A man died after jumping from a ledge in panic, while another fractured his leg attempting to escape. Firefighters and disaster management teams rescued several individuals, some suffering from smoke inhalation, as concerns arose about others potentially trapped inside.

title: Trump defends China tariffs, says 'they deserve it'
content: US President Donald Trump defended his trade policies, asserting China would likely bear the tariff costs. In an ABC News interview, Trump dismissed concerns about price increases, stating China was "ripping us off." He doubled down on China tariffs, saying 'They deserve it.

title: CSK vs PBKS: Playing XI, MA pitch report, weather in Chennai
content: Chennai Super Kings, struggling with only two wins, face Punjab Kings at Chepauk in a crucial IPL encounter. CSK's batting combinations and powerplay woes persist despite MS Dhoni's return as captain. Punjab Kings, with a stronger position, aim to exploit CSK's weaknesses, leveraging their in-form bowlers against a demoralized Chennai unit in anticipated warm conditions.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 24,300; BSE Sensex dips over 150 points
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, opened in red on Wednesday. While Nifty50 went below 24,300, BSE Sensex was near 80,100. At 9:16 AM, Nifty50 was trading at 24,293.95, down 42 points or 0.17%. BSE Sensex was at 80,133.01, down 155 points or 0.19%.

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi reminds me of Adam Gilchrist: Michael Hussey
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old batting sensation, has captured the attention of cricket legends like Michael Hussey and James Hopes. Hussey likened Vaibhav's explosive batting to Adam Gilchrist's, emphasizing his fearless approach against top bowlers. Hopes highlighted the confidence of 'Gen Z' batters and the strong position of Indian cricket in white-ball formats, noting the exposure young talents receive in India.

title: Gold rate prediction on Akshaya Tritiya: Where are gold prices headed?
content: Gold rate prediction: Gold prices have experienced a slight dip despite disappointing US economic data, influenced by hopes of easing US-China trade tensions and President Trump's tariff decisions. Buying gold on Akshaya Tritiya is considered auspicious according to Indian traditions. But what’s the outlook for gold and what factors will drive gold prices in the coming days?

title: Pak Propaganda Punctured, Government Fact-Checks Claim On Army Commander
content: A wave of misinformation has flooded social media as Pakistan tries to push its propaganda online in the wake of the Pahalgam terror attack. One such misinformation pertains to Lt Gen MV Suchindra Kumar, the commander of the Northern Army.

title: Explained: What's At Stake In Singapore Election 2025
content: Singapore holds a parliamentary election on May 3, the first big test for new Prime Minister Lawrence Wong as his People's Action Party seeks to extend its unbroken rule of the city-state and emerge with a stronger mandate.

title: "Excess Water Will Go To Pak If..." Haryana's 'Bhakra Dam' Request To Punjab
content: Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini urged Punjab counterpart Bhagwant Mann to provide drinking water to Haryana or the excess Bhakra reservoir water will flow to Pakistan.

title: Filipino Cardinal, The 'Asian Francis' Is Frontrunner For Papacy
content: Asia's front-runner for the papacy, Cardinal Luis Antonio Tagle of the Philippines is a charismatic moderate often dubbed the "Asian Francis".

title: "Rs 2,000 Crore Scam": New Case Against AAP's Manish Sisodia, Satyendar Jain
content: The anti-corruption branch has registered a case against former AAP ministers Manish Sisodia and Satyendar Jain over alleged corruption in the construction of classroom at highly exorbitant costs.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Updates: PM Modi's High-Level Security Meet Begins
content: The Pakistan Army opened fire across the International Border in Jammu and Kashmir's Pargawal sector, taking it beyond the Line of Control (LoC).

title: Gangotri And Yamunotri Portals Open Now As Char Dham Yatra Begins
content: The sacred Char Dham Yatra commenced on Wednesday with the ceremonial opening of the portals of Gangotri and Yamunotri Dham in the Uttarkashi district of Uttarakhand.

title: Pakistan Minister's 2 Am Press Conference And A "Military Action" Claim
content: Pakistan has claimed that it has "credible information" that India is planning a military action in the next 24-36 hours, with the relations between the two neighbours souring after the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Major Escalation By Pakistan, Firing At International Border, India Responds
content: The Pakistan Army opened fire across the International Border in Jammu and Kashmir's Pargawal sector, a day after ceasefire violations continued for the sixth consecutive day.

title: Afghan Students Wear Turbans, Tunics, Reflect Taliban-Rule
content: The Taliban government's education ministry cites strengthening discipline, masking social inequalities and promoting what the authorities see as true Islamic attire as reasons for the dress code change.

title: Around 600 North Korean Soldiers Killed Fighting For Russia: Seoul Lawmaker
content: Around 600 North Korean soldiers fighting for Russia against Ukraine have been killed and thousands more wounded, a Seoul lawmaker said Wednesday, after Pyongyang officially confirmed deploying troops to aid Moscow.

title: Donald Trump's Michigan Speech: Claims vs Facts
content: In a visit Tuesday to Warren, Michigan, President Donald Trump celebrated his first 100 days back in office by touting his accomplishments, while embellishing some and misrepresenting others.

title: Indian Tech Entrepreneur Kills Wife, Son, Then Dies By Suicide In US
content: An Indian tech entrepreneur allegedly shot dead his wife and one of his sons at their home in the United States last week, said the police. The man, said cops, then died by suicide.

title: Fossils Reveal Final Refuge Of Ferocious Land-Living Crocs
content: Fossils recently unearthed in the Dominican Republic reveal that the islands of the Caribbean served as an unexpected last refuge for these ferocious predators.

title: PM Modi Holds Key Meet On Pahalgam. Why It Is Significant
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is holding a crucial meeting of the Cabinet Committee on Political Affairs or CCPA -- the most important committee of the cabinet that has also been dubbed the "Super Cabinet".

title: Congress Passes Bill To Combat Revenge Porn. All About "Take It Down Act"
content: Congress has overwhelmingly approved bipartisan legislation to enact stricter penalties for the distribution of non-consensual intimate imagery, sometimes called "revenge porn."

title: US Puts India On "Priority Watch List" For Alleged IP Rights Violations
content: The United States has placed India, along with China and Russia, on its "priority watchlist" of countries on its radar for deficiencies and violations of intellectual property rights (IPR).

title: From Tendulkar to Yuvraj, when teens conquered our imagination
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi's recent century prompted a look back at other Indian teenage cricket prodigies. Sachin Tendulkar's explosive innings against Pakistan at 16, Yuvraj Singh's impactful arrival against Australia, and Irfan Pathan's magical delivery to dismiss Adam Gilchrist are highlighted.

title: Homework incomplete, but RR’s boy wonder is rewriting history books
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a prodigious cricket talent from Bihar, overcame age restrictions to shine. Coaches recognized his potential early, fast-tracking him to U-19 cricket where he impressed with aggressive batting. His U-19 Test debut featured a record-breaking century.

title: WATCH: Kuldeep Yadav caught slapping Rinku Singh on camera
content: Following their IPL match, Delhi Capitals' Kuldeep Yadav playfully slapped KKR's Rinku Singh, both representing Uttar Pradesh, in a friendly exchange. KKR defeated DC by 14 runs, boosting their playoff hopes. KKR's innings was propelled by Angkrish Raghuvanshi (44) and Rinku Singh (36), while Sunil Narine's 3/29 restricted DC to 190/9 despite contributions from Faf du Plessis and Axar Patel.

title: 7 killed in wall collapse at temple in Andhra Pradesh's Simhachalam
content: At least seven people were killed and several injured when a wall collapsed at the Sri Varaha Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple in Simhachalam, Andhra Pradesh, early Wednesday morning. The incident, triggered by heavy rain and strong winds around 2.30am, occurred just before the temple's first darshan on Akshaya Tritiya. Rescue efforts by NDRF and state teams are ongoing. Authorities have assured a thorough investigation and compensation for victims.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers' DVP Mehul Kothari recommends buying Inox Wind, Symphony, and Jyoti CNC. Inox Wind, exhibiting strength above its 200 DEMA, is a buy in the ₹170-₹173 range, targeting ₹190. Symphony, recovering from a recent decline, is poised to retest its moving averages, with a target of ₹1260.

title: Pakistan claims it downed Indian drone, tensions escalate along LoC
content: Pakistan claims to have shot down an Indian quadcopter, alleging airspace violation amid escalating tensions and cross-border firing. This incident follows the Pahalgam attack, further straining relations as both nations engage in retaliatory measures, including trade suspensions and military posturing. With heightened rhetoric and media fueling the conflict, the region teeters on the brink of a broader confrontation.

title: Where does gold come from? Nasa has the answer
content: As Akshaya Tritiya approaches, a new study suggests the gold in your jewelry and smartphones may originate from magnetar explosions billions of years ago. NASA data indicates that powerful flares from magnetars could account for up to 10% of heavy elements, including gold.

title: Hashim Moosa, Pahalgam Killer On The Run, Is Former Pak Commando: Sources
content: Security agencies have identified three terrorists involved in plotting the Pahalgam terror attack in which 25 tourists and a Kashmiri pony ride operator were shot dead in cold blood

title: Bengaluru Man Alleges Owner Refused To Rent Him Flat For Being A Kannadiga
content: A Bengaluru man looking to rent a property was allegedly discriminated against by the owner, who said she wouldn't give it to a Kannadiga.

title: Simhachalam wall collapse: Naidu announces ₹25 lakh ex-gratia to kin of deceased; forms three-member committee to probe incident
content: N. Chandrababu Naidu said that one member from each family will be employed on an outsourcing basis in the temples under the purview of the Endowments Department

title: Kolkata hotel fire: Three from Tamil Nadu killed; CM Stalin condoles deaths
content: The six-storeyed Rituraj Hotel, located in the Burrabazxar area of Kolkata, had 88 people in 42 rooms and about 60 staff present on the premises, according to the Kolkata police

title: 2024 protest case: Delhi court exempts TMC leaders from personal appearance
content: Judge Mittal, meanwhile, noted the presence of TMC leader Vivek Gupta and directed him to appear before the court on the next date of hearing to file a bail bond

title: Supreme Court upholds inclusive digital access as a part of fundamental right to life
content: ‘The right to digital access emerges as an instinctive component of the right to life and liberty, necessitating the state to proactively design and implement inclusive digital ecosystems to serve not only the privileged, but also the marginalised and those who have been historically excluded’

title: Satya Chandrasekharendra Saraswathi anointed as 71st pontiff of Kanchi Kamakoti Peetam
content: He is a Rigvedic scholar from Annavaram Kshetra in Andhra Pradesh and had served at the Sri Gnana Saraswathi Devasthanam in Basara, Telangana

title: Mumbai court issues non-bailable warrant against Mehul Choksi in loan fraud case
content: While Mehul Choksi is fighting for bail in a court in Belgium, the matter of the non-bailable warrant against him has been adjourned to June 2

title: Swiggy Instamart to deliver gold and silver coins from Kalyan Jewellers
content: Kalyan Jewellers announced its debut on Swiggy Instamart, allowing users to have gold and silver coins delivered to their homes in minutes

title: CCPA to take call on opposition's demand for special session of Parliament: Meghwal
content: Union Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal addresses opposition demands for a special Parliament session following a terror attack

title: Irregular water supply in Hubballi-Dharwad comes up for discussion in municipal council
content: The issue leads to elaborate discussion during monthly council meeting of Hubballi-Dharwad Municipal Corporation

title: Kolkata hotel fire: SIT to probe cause; CM Mamata monitors situation as 14 dead
content: Firefighters continued rescue operations overnight as the 10 engines rushed to the spot; President Murmu, PM Modi condoles loss of lives in fire accident and announces announces ex-gratia

title: Pahalgam attack: Pakistan Army initiates unprovoked firing along LoC in J&K; India ‘responds swiftly’
content: The firing, which began with small arms, was reported from the Pargwal sector along the IB in Jammu district, and the Sunderbani and Naushera sectors in Rajouri district

title: Speeding goods carrier rams into nursing students in Gadwal, two killed, two injured
content: The victims, identified as Manisha and Maheshwari, both aged around 16, were students at the Government College of Nursing near the Old SP office

title: High temperatures and mango production | Explained
content: What’s the quantum of growth in India? What are the challenges? How does mango production in India compare to that of China and Thailand? Does genetic diversity play a role in the hardiness and productivity of the fruit? How does it help it combat climate change?

title: What is the controversy over Bengal school scam? | Explained
content: Why were hundreds of teachers of State-run schools protesting outside the West Bengal School Service Commission? Has the list of ‘tainted’ and ‘untainted’ candidates been made public?

title: Mother Dairy hikes milk prices by up to ₹2/litre
content: The prices of toned milk (bulk vended) has been increased to ₹56 per litre from ₹54 per litre in Delhi-NCR

title: Congress deletes ‘gayab’ post on PM Modi after backlash; Venugopal cautions leaders to adhere to party line on Pahalgam
content: Mr. Venugopal, in the letter, said the Congress party is deeply anguished by the reprehensible terrorist attack in Pahalgam and stands in unwavering solidarity with the nation during this hour of grief

title: Pushpa 2 stampede: Eight-year-old injured boy discharged after four months, shifted to rehab centre
content: According to KIMS Hospital, the child is now taking oral feeds and no longer requires oxygen or respiratory support

title: All set for relaunch of Amaravati capital works  by Prime Minister on May 2, says A.P. Urban Development Minister Narayana
content: The government aims at completing the construction of the capital city as per the master plan in three years, he says

title: CAG audit finds colleges overcharging students
content: The CAG recommended that strict instructions be issued to colleges to collect only the prescribed fees and take steps to direct the colleges to refund the excess amount collected

title: My journey for T.N., Tamils, State’s rights will continue: Stalin
content: Contending that the DMK government was “thousand times better” than the 10-year rule of the erstwhile AIADMK regime, Mr. Stalin said his government has made achievements on various fronts.

title: ‘Community building online comes with both opportunities, challenges’
content: To build healthier online communities, it is essential to focus on shared goals, empathy, and constructive dialogue, say students of IIT-M during a panel discussion at The Hindu Huddle on Campus

title: Vizhinjam set to celebrate its storied past
content: Idea for a modern port at Vizhinjam was first mooted by C.P. Ramaswamy Iyer, who gave orders for a survey in mid-1940s. However, no invite was issued for member of survey team

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Centre exempts many more from repatriation to Pakistan
content: Pakistani Hindus who have ‘applied for long-term visas’ and whose applications are ‘under process’ have been exempted; on April 28-29, as many as 249 Pakistanis left India via Attari

title: Axiom space mission: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla to fly to International Space Station on May 29
content: The Axiom Mission 4 crew will be launched aboard a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft to the ISS and will spend up to 14 days at the orbiting laboratory.

title: LDF govt.’s 4th anniversary celebrations riddled with corruption, alleges Chennithala
content: Mr. Chennithala criticised the government for not inviting Leader of the Opposition V.D. Satheesan to the commissioning of the Vizhinjam port

title: Goshree islanders annoyed over ‘unscientific’ schedule of private and KSRTC buses
content: Poorly planned timings for nine private and ten KSRTC buses, launched recently on city routes, have led to their inefficient use, resulting in inadequate revenue from sale of tickets

title: Withdrawal of discount cards by KMRL deals a blow to city students’ travel plans
content: This has increased my travel cost, and is also causing delays, sometimes making us late for class, says a student as she is left with no choice but to depend on buses to reach her college

title: BMRCL signs seven-year ad deals for Namma Metro trains
content: The deal allows full-train wrapping and interior advertising, turning metro coaches into mobile canvases for brand promotions.

title: Fire in central Kolkata’s hotel, one dead
content: One person died after jumping from the building to escape the fire. The multi-storey building where the fire broke out is a hotel on Madan Mohan Barman Street

title: Digha’s Jagannath Temple inauguration is Trinamool’s Ram temple moment
content: In the highly polarised political landscape of Bengal, the Jagannath Temple is the ruling party’s answer to the allegations of being ‘fake-Hindu’ levelled at it by the BJP

title: Binoy Viswam to attend May Day fete in Sri Lanka
content: Though the CPI and JVP have been in touch for over a decade, this is the first official meeting between leaders of the two parties

title: Second harassment incident within months: CPI(M) expels former MP
content: This is the second such incident of harassment and suspension among senior party leadership in West Bengal

title: Mamata donates ₹5 lakh broom for Jagannath temple, participates in yagna ahead of inauguration
content: The inaugural programme of the Jagannath temple at Digha will be held Wednesday after which the gates of the temple will be opened for the general public

title: Pahalgam terror attack: 22-year-old India-Pakistan ceasefire pact hangs by a thread as armies exchange fire for 4th day in J&K
content: Officials said a zipline operator, questioned by the NIA after a viral video, had ‘no role’ in the Pahalgam attack

title: State announces Financial assistance of ₹50 lakh to Pahalgam attack victims
content: Six natives of Maharashtra — Sanjay Lele, Hemant Joshi, Atul Mone (all Dombivli residents ), Dilip Disle (Panvel), Kaustubh Ganbote and Santosh Jagdale (residents of Pune) — were killed in the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Karnataka orders closure of Auxiliary Nursing Midwife courses, ANMTC centres
content: The already enrolled students have been asked to move to B.Sc. Nursing/General Nursing and Midwife (GNM) course

title: BRS rebuts Govt. point-wise on NDSA report on Kaleshwaram project Barrages
content: Harish Rao asks Congress Govt. why it had not taken up Tummidihatti Barrage till 2014 after taking up Pranahita-Chevalla project in 2007

title: Tejashwi promises safety to the Vaishya community and ticket in Assembly election
content: Mr. Yadav accused that the central and state governments were harassing the Vaishya community economically. He claimed that due to incidents of murder, robbery, crime and atrocities against businessmen, fear prevails among them.

title: Attorney General of India R. Venkataramani is set to hold all–India conference to promote mediation
content: Chief Justices and Advocate Generals of various states will attend the conference, which will be inaugurated by President Droupadi Murmu.

title: Like Kashmir, go after terrorists from Myanmar too: Manipur group
content: The Coordinating Committee on Manipur Integrity resented the Centre’s double standards in dealing with terror groups on two different frontiers of India

title: ED attaches over 1000 acres of land of a company accused of illegal financial dealings
content: The ED says the action has been taken under the provisions of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002

title: Insufficient support for deep tech start-ups in India: study
content: Labs of the ‘strategic sector’ such as those belonging to defence research, space, atomic energy research — all of which constitute the lion’s share of India’s overall Research and Development (R&D) spend — were excluded from the study due to the “sensitive nature of their work”

title: Rahul Gandhi reviews development projects in Rae Bareli, visits rail coach factory
content: As part of his itinerary, the Leader of Opposition is likely to visit family of youth killed in Pahalgam terror attack

title: Cyberattacks by Pakistan groups on 4 defence facilities thwarted
content: The websites of two Army Public Schools, the Army Welfare Housing Organisation database, and the Indian Air Force Placement Organisation were promptly isolated, and restorative action taken

title: Collector urges more individuals, MSMEs to participate in P4 initiative
content: Mentors must ensure that the families they assist come out of poverty and have enough means to sustain themselves.

title: BMTC to roll out 320 AC electric buses in Bengaluru by May-end
content: Electric buses are supplied by OHM Global Mobility, a subsidiary of Ashok Leyland, under the Gross Cost Contract model

title: Newly-wed CRPF jawan’s wife among women on J&K repatriation list
content: Political leaders across the spectrum have criticised the repatriations, and have called on the Centre to adopt a rational and humanitarian approach

title: Supreme Court asks Sambhal mosque management to respond to Uttar Pradesh report on disputed well
content: The U.P. government’s status report said that a disputed well stood ‘completely outside’ the mosque precincts, contrary to what the Muslim side said in the apex court

title: PM Modi congratulates Carney on election victory; signals possible reset in ties with Canada
content: Prime Minister’s reference to India and Canada sharing “democratic values” with “commitment to rule of law” paints a picture of political hopes for positive bilateral relations, after two years of tensions following allegations in Nijjar killing case.

title: Justice B.R. Gavai appointed next Chief Justice of India, to take charge on May 14
content: Justice Gavai will have a tenure of six months and would demit office on December 23 on attaining the age of 65.

title: Karnataka High Court directs BSWML to complete tender to chose contractors for city’s solid waste management within four months
content: The court allows Bangalore Solid Waste Management Ltd to go ahead with tender invited on November 7, 2024 but allows disqualified or unsuccessful biders also to participate in the present tender

title: Passengers face hardship in the absence of public restrooms
content: For thousands of commuters using the suburban trains, the lack of public conveniences tops the list of their grievances. The problem is more severe in the western section where commuters find it difficult to use the toilets at the stations as most of them are locked

title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat meets Prime Minister Modi in the wake of Pahalgam terror attack
content: In the hour-long meeting, also attended by Amit Shah, the security situation in Kashmir as well as the proposed response were discussed

title: CIFT incubatee recognised as Best Fisheries Startup
content: The fisheries meet is organised by the Union government under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana

title: Object behind POCSO Act will be defeated if offence is condoned due to romantic relationships or subsequent marriage: Madras High Court
content: Justice P. Velmurugan punishes a youngster to 10 years of imprisonment for having had sexual intercourse with his wife when she was a minor

title:
From prohibition to monopoly: tracing liquor policy and emergence of 
TASMAC
content: M.G. Ramachandran’s government decided in 1983 to take over the wholesale trade in arrack and Indian Made Foreign Spirits from June 1, 1983. An ordinance to this effect was promulgated by the Governor. A public sector corporation, known as Tamil Nadu State Marketing Corporation, was formed for supply of arrack and IMFS to retailers

title: Karnataka High Court extends deadline for Rapido, Ola, and Uber to stop operation of their bike taxis till June 15
content: The aggregators pointed out to the court that their representation given State government for framing of policy allowing the operation of bike taxis is pending consideration before the authorities

title: When ‘anti-liquor propaganda’ gathered momentum in Madras nearly a century ago
content: On October 22, 1927, the Madras Legislative Council passed a resolution recommending to the British India government that total prohibition in the Presidency within a course of 20 years be declared its goal. District committees were formed in the Presidency for the propaganda. It was halted after September 1931 because of financial stringency

title: Suspended IPS officer Anjaneyulu grilled for two days in Bollywood actress case
content: The CID police had arrested the suspended IPS officer on April 21, from his residence in Hyderabad. The court granted three days police custody of the accused

title: Siddaramaiah targeting officials comes out of frustration, says Ashok
content: Claims Karnataka Chief Minister had spoken ‘in favour of Pakistan’ with respect to the Pahalgam terror attack

title: A school at Mylapore that takes in the poor
content: The school derived its name from St. Ebba, the daughter of the King of Northumbria. A plaque at the school entrance gives details of St. Ebba. She lived in 7 A.D. and became a Scottish saint.

title: No change in outsourcing of operation and maintenance of new bus terminal, says Tiruchi Mayor
content: The swanky new bus terminal was one of the largest bus stands in the country and required a dedicated team to maintain it, says Tiruchi Mayor M. Anbazhagan

title: NEP changed country’s education system: PM
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi says new initiatives have enhanced access to modern education and new career pathways. He adds that the research system has improved with increased resources and funding

title: No cholera outbreak situation in capital, health standing committee chairperson
content: Modern slaughterhouse in Kunnukuzhy will be inaugurated soon as part of State government’s fourth anniversary celebrations, says Mayor

title: 32 teams, 32 questions, 32 answers: Taking stock of what's ahead this offseason
content: the 2025 NFL draft wrapped up in green Bay, Wisconsin . there are 257 new faces joining the league, but will they help solve teams' woes? what questions linger after the three-day player selection extravaganza .

title: Eastern Conference playoffs: Bucks crumble in epic collapse, Pacers advance
content: the 2025 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . one team is in with the no. 2 Boston Celtics ousting the No. 7 seed Orlando Magic on Tuesday . the defending champions will await the winner between the New York Knicks and the Detroit Pistons in their high-drama series .

title: College baseball Week 11: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: the longhorns remain the top of the class in all of baseball and the SEC . but it was the only top team to hold onto its spot as the rest of the top 10 underwent quite a shakeup . this week's biggest climber is NC State, which jumped 12 spots to no. 13 after sweeping Clemson .

title: College softball rankings after Week 12: Are the Sooners back on top?
content: the 2025 college softball regular season is nearing its end, as conference tournaments begin next week . the top three teams in last week's standings all lost their series . we dive into our latest ESPN.com/USA Softball Collegiate top 25 ranking .

title: Madden NFL 26: Everything we know about its release date, editions and preorder bonuses
content: Madden NFL 26 will be released on PC, PS5, Xbox Series X|S and Nintendo Switch 2 . the game will leave behind PS4 and Xbox One entirely, instead making its long-awaited return to a console for the first time since madden NFL 13 . a bit over a month after EA CFB 26, dedicated fans will have enough time to enjoy their high school and college careers .

title: Sources: Pogba eyeing Europe despite D.C. talks
content: pogba has been linked with a move to a team in europe . the 32-year-old has been without a club since his contract was terminated by Juventus last November . he is the only MLS team currently able to enter into negotiations with him .

title: 'I could have never imagined that this would happen': How a group of Korean harmonica players captivated the world
content: Donna Lee played the harmonica as a child in music class in the united states . in 2023, she joined the center's harmonica class, in which she practiced "the Star-Spangled Banner" she and her classmates repeatedly practiced the "star-spangled banner"

title: Garcia? Teofimo? Canelo? Inoue? A lapsed fan's guide to a big boxing weekend
content: this weekend will see three consecutive nights of fight cards featuring four current or former ESPN pound-for-pound fighters . Easily the most unique location of the weekend is Times Square in New York City, where Garcia, Haney and Lopez will compete in separate fights in the renowned public space .

title: 6-Year-Old Karnataka Girl Run Over By Garbage Van
content: Hameedabanu Kabade, 6, was walking in an alley when a garbage van ran over her, killing her on the spot. The incident occurred in Karnataka's Hubballi on Monday (April 28), at around 11 am, and was caught on camera. It was a regular Monday morning. The garbage tipper was making its way from one alley to another, collecting household waste. At 11:17 am, a girl was seen walking next to the garbage truck until she suddenly came to the front. The garbage tipper knocked her down and ran over her, killing her on the spot. In the video, the girl can be seen caught under the wheels. The body of the child was reportedly moved to KIMS hospital for a post-mortem. The garbage truck belonged to the Hubballi Dharwad Municipal Corporation (HDMC) and is under police custody. A case has been registered against the driver, as per a local media report. Track  Latest News  Live on NDTV.com and get  news  updates from  India   and around the  world
